#Text=Lansing
#Text=Lansing is an aesthetically pleasing city , and as Michigan 's state capital , it is home to many government offices .
#Text=Downtown
#Text=Lansing has a historic shopping district amidst the campus of Thomas M. Cooley Law School .

#Text=Its suburb — East Lansing — is the home of Michigan State University , a Big Ten school and one of the United States ' largest and most distinguished public universities with three medical schools and a law school .
#Text=General Motors has a major presence in the area .
#Text=The Lansing metro area has a population of about 464,000 ( 2010 ) .
#Text=By car
#Text=Lansing is easily accessible from Detroit and Chicago .
#Text=Interstate 96 directly connects Lansing and East Lansing to Detroit and Grand Rapids .
#Text=US-127 to Interstate 94 connects Lansing and East Lansing to Chicago , Ann Arbor , and Detroit .
#Text=Interstate 69 connects Lansing and East Lansing to Flint and Fort Wayne .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Capital Area Transportation Authority ( CATA ) provides local bus service .
#Text=Greyhound Lines service
#Text=Lansing and East Lansing , with direct connections to Detroit , Grand Rapids , and Kalamazoo ( with transfers to Chicago ) .
#Text=Owosso , Michigan-based Indian Trails Bus Lines provides daily service to Chicago .
#Text=Michigan Flyer Motorcoach service provides multiple daily connections to Detroit Metropolitan Airport with stops in Jackson and Ann Arbor .
#Text=By train
#Text=Amtrak provides one daily train service via the Blue Water Service , which connects to Flint and Port Huron to the east and Battle Creek , Kalamazoo , and Chicago to the west .
#Text=There 's also Amtrak Thruway Buses to the Wolverine line between Chicago and Detroit as well as the Capitol and Lake Shore Limited services via Toledo .
#Text=All trains depart from ( +1 800-872-7245 ) , located on 1240 S Harrison Rd next to the Michigan State University in East Lansing .
#Text=CATA 's route 20 provides service to the station for both departures and arrivals on weekdays , and for arrivals to East Lansing on Saturday .
#Text=Connections to downtown Lansing are provided by route 1 .
#Text=By plane
#Text=( LAN ) is in DeWitt Township , 3 miles ( 5 km ) northwest of downtown Lansing on Grand River Avenue ( Business Route 96 ) .
#Text=Capital Region International Airport offers non-stop domestic flights to Detroit , Chicago , Minneapolis , Atlanta , Washington D.C. , and Orlando .
#Text=Non-stop international flights are available seasonally to Cancún and Puerto Vallarta , Mexico ; and Punta Cana , Dominican Republic .
#Text=A concierge travel center in the airport terminal offers the ability to book airline tickets , cruises , tours , car rentals , and hotel rooms .
#Text=The airport is served by Capital Area Transit Authority ( CATA ) bus line 14 , which provides direct service to downtown Lansing .
#Text=Detroit Metropolitan Airport , Flint Bishop International Airport , and Grand Rapids Gerald R. Ford International Airport are other nearby airports which serve the region .
#Text=By taxi
#Text=A large number of taxi companies provide around the clock service to the Lansing-area .
#Text=It is not necessary to call ahead for evening taxi service near downtown East Lansing , but riders should allow at least 30 minutes for taxi service to arrive elsewhere .
#Text=This is especially true on weekends .
#Text=A service in the Meridian Township area is Meridian Transportation LLC .
#Text=They can be reached at 517-339-TAXI ( 8294 )
#Text=Get around
#Text=Lansing is served by a number of highways .
#Text=Travel by car to any part of the city normally takes very little time .
#Text=Traffic is generally light in the region .
#Text=While there is some rush hour traffic , visitors driving in the region should not anticipate heavy congestion .
#Text=The heaviest traffic is concentrated on the east and west sides of the city .
#Text=The Lansing-area is served by the Capital Area Transportation Authority ( CATA ) bus system .
#Text=Visitors should find bus service to downtown Lansing , downtown East Lansing , and Michigan State University a convenient and affordable alternative to driving .

#Text=Buses along the Michigan/Grand River Ave corridor ( Route 1 ) , which travel between downtown Lansing and East Lansing , run until 3AM on Thursday , Friday , and Saturday , making it easy to avoid driving and parking fees .
#Text=CATA recommends using the smartphone app Transit to plan trips , track buses in real time , and see up-to-date departure information .
#Text=Many companies provide taxi service throughout the area .
#Text=Taxi service is heavily concentrated in the downtown East Lansing-area , especially during evenings and weekends .
#Text=There is no need to call ahead for taxis in downtown East Lansing , as an available taxi can always be found on Albert Street behind downtown East Lansing .
#Text=In downtown Lansing , taxi service is not as frequent .
#Text=Taxi service usually arrives in under 30 minutes .
#Text=Visitors should expect longer delays on the weekends and during Michigan State University football games .
#Text=The City of Lansing provides an extensive river walk trail along the Red Cedar River and Grand River .

#Text=Visitors will enjoy strolling along the Red Cedar as it meanders through the beautiful Michigan State University campus , through dense forest , past the City of Lansing 's Potter Park Zoo , where the Red Cedar joins the Grand River ( Michigan 's largest river ) and continues through downtown Lansing , Cooley Law School Stadium ( formerly Oldsmobile Park ) , home of the Lansing Lugnuts minor league baseball team , the downtown Farmer 's Market , and to the River Walk terminus near the historic Old Town on Lansing 's north side .
#Text=The area offers many bike lanes , especially in East Lansing near the Michigan State University .
#Text=Whether on foot or by bike , the area offers plenty of sidewalks , bike lanes , and trails to connect pedestrians to all the local attractions .
#Text=For visitors arriving or leaving , Lansing is well-connected to the major regional transportation hubs of Chicago and Detroit .
#Text=The Capital Region International Airport , Amtrak , CATA , Greyhound Bus Lines , Indian Trails , and Michigan Flyer provide transportation services to and from Lansing .
#Text=Freeways I-96 , I-496 , I-69 , and US-127 provide fast and convenient connections throughout the Lansing area .
#Text=See
#Text=Lansing is the state capital of Michigan and the regional center of Mid-Michigan .
#Text=The city 's population is under 115,000 and the metropolitan is under 500,000 .
#Text=Do not expect the big city lights and action of a metropolitan of millions .
#Text=But there are still many great things to do in and around Lansing .
#Text=Yes , it snows in Michigan .
#Text=So embrace the beauty of the seasons , and plan your activities accordingly .
